project_overview.name: Aztec Network
project_overview.tagline: The first decentralized, privacy-preserving L2 on Ethereum

description: Aztec is a privacy-first Layer 2 zkRollup on Ethereum that brings programmable privacy to smart contracts. It enables confidential transactions and private state through zero-knowledge proofs, combining public and private execution into a single rollup with seamless composability across encrypted and unencrypted transactions.

key_repositories.name: aztec-nr
key_repositories.description: Mirror of Aztec smart contract framework for Noir

key_repositories.name: aztec-starter
key_repositories.description: Simple Aztec contract + test to get started

technical_highlights.privacy_model: UTXO-based private state with encrypted notes and nullifiers
key_features: Programmable privacy at user, data, metadata, transaction, and code levels
Client-side proof generation (proofs generated on user devices)
Hybrid execution: private functions run locally, public functions on network
UTXO model for private state, account-based model for public state
Composable privacy across chains via bridges (Wormhole, TRAIN, Substance)
Decentralized sequencing, proving, and governance from day one
Noir DSL for writing private smart contracts

noir_language.description: Open-source Domain-Specific Language for safe and seamless construction of privacy-preserving Zero-Knowledge programs
features: Backend agnostic - compiles to ACIR intermediate representation
Supports integers, booleans, strings, arrays, slices, tuples, structs
Works on cloud backends and smartphones

decentralization_pillars: Decentralized sequencing - anyone can run a sequencer node
trust_model.escape_hatch: Opens every 8 hours for 2-hour window allowing anyone to submit rollup proofs

cryptography.proving_system: PLONK (Permutations over Lagrange-bases for Oecumenical Noninteractive arguments of Knowledge)
cryptography.plonk_inventors: Ariel Gabizon, Zac Williamson, Oana Ciobotaru
plonk_variants: TurboPlonk - enhanced PLONK with additional boolean gates
UltraPlonk - variant using Ultra circuit arithmetisation
Honk - highly optimized PLONK with sum-check protocol
Goblin Plonk - recursion for resource-constrained provers
elliptic_curves: Grumpkin - paired with BN254 for curve cycling
cryptography.trusted_setup: Universal and updateable (single setup for all programs up to max size)

security_audits.scope: Aztec Connect upstream contracts and cryptography systems

security_audits.result: Completed - compared Noir with Circom and o1js

known_vulnerabilities.issue: BigField class vulnerability allowing incorrect equations to be proven mod p
known_vulnerabilities.affected: Rollup proofs only - Aztec was sole provider
known_vulnerabilities.resolution: Added range check of 32 bits to tree index variable in joinsplit circuit
known_vulnerabilities.exploitation: No exploitation occurred - fixed before any external parties could exploit

known_vulnerabilities.issue: Insufficient range checks in non-native field operations (CRT-based)
known_vulnerabilities.resolution: Added more strict range checks and asserts in BigField class

leadership.name: Zac Williamson
leadership.background: PhD in particle physics, worked at CERN and T2K Japan, co-invented PLONK

leadership.name: Joe Andrews
leadership.background: Former CTO of Radish (Silicon Valley food tech), B.Eng. Materials Science from Imperial College London

leadership.name: Ariel Gabizon
leadership.background: PhD Theoretical Computer Science from Weizmann Institute, worked on STARKs, helped with first Zcash trusted setup, co-author of PLONK

regulatory_context.ceo_position: Privacy networks can be consistent with regulator goals while protecting user privacy
regulatory_context.selective_disclosure: Users can prove parts of their identity without full disclosure
regulatory_context.post_tornado_cash: Benefited from Nov 2024 court ruling that OFAC sanctions on Tornado Cash were illegal
risks: Increased regulatory scrutiny for privacy-focused projects

contract_addresses.note: Full L1 contract list available in AztecProtocol/l1-contracts repository

timeline.2019: PLONK paper published by Gabizon, Williamson, Ciobotaru
timeline.2022-05: Security audits completed for Aztec Connect
timeline.2023-03: Sunset of zk.money and Aztec Connect announced (decision to not progressively decentralize)
timeline.2025-09: Network upgrade with redesigned slashing system
timeline.2025-11: Ignition Chain launched (first decentralized L2 consensus layer)

differentiators_vs_public_rollups: Private by default - optional privacy at every level
Client-side proof generation - data never leaves user device
UTXO model for private state (vs account model)
Encrypted notes with nullifiers prevent double-spending while hiding ownership
Hybrid execution: private functions local, public functions on-chain
Composable privacy across multiple chains via bridges
gaps_and_missing_data: Exact team size not publicly disclosed
Complete list of L1 contract addresses requires checking live deployment
Detailed tokenomics breakdown beyond sale allocation
CertiK audit status - project not audited by CertiK according to their platform
Detailed validator economics and rewards structure

research_metadata.researcher_notes: Aztec is one of the most significant privacy L2 projects on Ethereum, with strong cryptographic foundations (PLONK invention), substantial funding, and a commitment to day-one decentralization. The team's decision to sunset earlier products rather than progressively decentralize shows commitment to principles. Security posture is strong with multiple audits, $2M bug bounty, and responsible vulnerability disclosure. Main risks are regulatory uncertainty and unproven adoption post-mainnet.
